subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Alphabetical Order
msgSnippet: ... But to be fair to Moira, that still means she has to give up a phoneme. What words would lose their distinction, Moira, if you had to use Awl for both On
messageBody:
John Cowan wrote:
>
>
> Moira O'Brien scripsit:
> > As a speaker of RP, I can't agree to the merger
> > of Awl Ah and On. My pronunciation makes full use of all three as
> > distinct sounds.
>
> It's not a merger of all three, just the elimination of Ox in favor of
> either Awe or Ah, depending on dialect. The four underlying lexical
> sets are the worst mess in the English dialects.
>

But to be fair to Moira, that still means she has to give up a phoneme.
What words would lose their distinction, Moira, if you had to use Awl
for both On and Awl?

Paul
